revision.text: {{also|xanthe}} ==English== ===Etymology=== From {{bor|en|grc|Ξανθή|lit=blond-haired}}, from {{m|grc|ξανθός|t=yellow}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|en|/ˈzænθi/}} * {{hyph|en|Xan|the}} ===Proper noun=== {{en-proper noun}} # {{lb|en|rare}} {{given name|en|female|from=Ancient Greek}}. #* '''2009''', {{w|Anne Tyler}}, ''Noah's Compass'', Vintage {{ISBN|9780099539582}}, page 165: #*: "So that was '''Xanthe'''," she said in a musing tone. #*: "You're thinking it's a misnomer ,aren't you," Liam said. #*: "What?" #*: "'''Xanthe'''. It means 'golden'." #*: "Well, I'm sure she's very pleasant as a rule." #*: Liam had been referring to '''Xanthe's''' coloring―her brown hair and level dark eyebrows. #* '''2012''', {{w|Anna Jacobs}}, ''The Trader's Dream'', Hachette UK {{ISBN|9781444714685}} #*: Maura looked at her in bafflement. What had this to do with her? She knew no one called '''Xanthe'''. What sort of name was that, anyway? ---- ==Latin== ===Proper noun=== {{la-proper noun-form|Xanthe}} # {{inflection of|la|Xanthus||voc|s}}
